name: Artemide Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on all the excellent reviews from tripadvisor and paid top dollar for this hotel. It was easy to locate since we opted to take the train from the airport (14 euros p/p) to termini station to avoid traffic so we can go straight to sight-seeing since we only have three nights in Rome. The hotel isn't necessarily a central location to the most popular sights in Rome but certainly walkable and very close to the metro (if you opt to take the trains which come very frequently ~ 6 min). We walked everywhere just to explore but definitely bring comfy shoes - the cobble stones are tough on both feet & legs! Our room is quite small (the tiniest bathroom I've ever seen) but very nice and that's probably why they gave us complimentary breakfast for our entire stay which is very nice. We faced the back and was very quiet.
reviews.title: A real four star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, things are more expensive in Rome then some other EU cities. There are shops along Via Nazionale so you don't necessarily need to go to the Spanish steps for shopping unless you're shopping for designer wear but since we're from NYC, we have lots of those shops.
reviews.title: Outstanding property

reviews.text: Of note is that this hotel doesn't nickel and dime you. There's free wi-fi, the oft mentioned free minibars & vouchers for welcome drinks at the roof-top bar. We arrived before noon and they had a room ready for us which is a really nice touch to just drop off your luggage and freshen up. Overall, this hotel is a gem!
reviews.title: IF YOU DON'T STAY HERE YOU'RE A FOOL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am pleased to add my voice to those who have already written so many favorable things about the Hotel Artemide. Though having been to Rome only this once, I have nothing to compare to. However, I can hardly think I would stay anywhere else upon returning to Rome. Service and amenities were excellent, breakfast was likewise excellent, and the rooftop bar was a wonderful touch as well. Recommendations from hotel staff were quite good, and they tried very hard to be helpful. I am not necessarily in agreement that Artemide is "centrally located" as others have commented, and that may be the one small issue we had ... many attractions are not within easy walking distance. But the bellmen are happy to call taxis, and the Republica metro stop is quite close (we had no issues with the metro, other than its limited capabilities). Please know, of course, that you will be paying top dollar for this establishment, particularly these days with the weak dollar. However, it was certainly worth it, and it was a pleasure to come "home" each day and night to the Artemide after sightseeing, dining, enjoying Rome, and so on.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city

reviews.text: This was our first time in Italy. We stayed here and were totally blown away. The customer service is impeccable and go above and beyond what is needed without having to be asked. Months prior to our arrival I had a lot of questions and concerns about our trip in general since it was our first time to Italy. This hotel is in the PERFECT location! In walking distance of EVERYTHING in Rome (except the Vatican, 40 min walk). I was in constant contact with Alessandro who answered everything with detail and certainty. They arranged for a car to pick us up to and from the hotel, taxis to take us places at a moments notice, arrange dinner reservations every night, called to make sure restaurants were open for us, made sure we knew where we were going everyday, gave excellent dining tips, told us where to stay away from, kept checking up on our flight home (hurricane Irene). The hotel rooftop restaurant is DELICIOUS and should not be overlooked. This restaurant has some serious top notch cuisine for a good price tag! They even researched with us (for about 20minutes) how to get to and from the island of Ponza, because my girlfriend and I wanted to travel by ourselves one day instead of with a tour. Rooms were VERY clean and nice size. Free mini bar, buffet breakfast every morning was delicious as well! To everyone that helped us: Alessandro, Mario, Valentina, Paolo, Matteo & the bell staff, Thank you SO very much for making our first (of many) time(s) in Rome a memorable one and we WILL be staying with you again!
reviews.title: Two weeks at the best hotel in Rome

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel with young family in August 2011 as part of celebration for my wife's 40th. Excellent location on Via Nazionale in central Rome. Easy walking distance of major sights such as Trevi fountian , Spanish steps and Colosseum amongst others. Very handily placed for undeground , Repubblica, and main railway station. Very friendly and helpful staff always wiling to assist whenever they could. Room easily accomodated double bed, bed settee and baby cot . Good sound proofing means that street noise was no issue. Free mini bar stocked every day of stay and godsend of air conditioning helped us cool down after the heat of the city . Breakfast was self service buffet and a mixutre of continental and cooked food.There was plenty to eat with a good selection for kids . Very nice roof top terrace bar with distant view of St Peter's Basicilica gave great photo opportunity at sunset. We would certainly stay here if returning to Rome, excellent value for money!
reviews.title: Fab location for wife's 40th birthday in Rome, strongly recommend !

reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic stay in Rome at the Hotel Artemide. Great location, close to Trevi Fountain, plenty of shops and trattorias close by. Rooms of good size (we stayed in superior room), plenty of bathroom amenities, free mini bar (re-stocked daily with water, soft drinks and beer), free wi-fi in room, tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast was plentiful and included cereals, pastries, cheeses, ham, breads and also bacon, eggs etc. Every member of staff was cheerful and extremely helpful throughout our stay. The only slight niggle was the air conditioning, which never seemed to quite do the job properly! Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay In Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this for my nephew and his new wife as a wedding present, emailed the hotel before asking if I could have a bottle of wine put in there room, they e mailed me back straight away saying it would be their pleasure to do this free of charge and did I want to leave a message with it, which was really nice of them. They also gave them a room upgrade which was brilliant.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon we will be back
Fabulous Hotel, Great Location, Perfect!
reviews.text: These are excerts from e mails recieved from them after they came back ' they gave us a superior room which was huge and it had a big jacuzzi bath too and overlooked the main street, it was gorgeous, the mini bar was free too and was re stocked everyday which was great' and the roof top was amazing, we went for drinks there quite a bit as it was so lovely sitting on the couches drinking prosecco,we want to go back!.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had 2 nights at Artemide Hotel in Rome and it was perfect. Fabulous service, clean, great location, close to all major sights and also train station, lovely breakfast and they surprised us with complimentary bottle of wine for my husbands 40th! A real treat to stay here!!
reviews.title: We really loved this hotel and we'll be back

reviews.title: Good value for money, excellent breakfast

reviews.text: The room was very comfortable and housekeeping staff were very quick to tidy the room when we were out.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in every way

reviews.text: The roof top bar was another highlight. Service from Renato, Emilio & Co. was first class.
reviews.title: Just perfect and a value for money

reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again, a very good hotel at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: A perfect ending to three weeks in Europe!

description: The Artemide Hotel is situated in the heart of Rome, 900 metres from the Termini railway station, in the shopping area of Via Nazionale. Recently renovated, the hotel has maintained its distinctive Art Nouveau elements in all common areas and also features extensive meeting facilities as well as a free Internet point, Wi-Fi connection, Gym with Sauna and a Roof terrace bar with its unforgettable views of Rome skyline.
